title: Ticket #4581: Local hostname and IP address unrelated
description:
In init_local_hostname() in ipv6_hostname.cpp, the hostname and IP address selected to identify the local machine have no explicit relationship to each other. On a machine with multiple network interfaces, we can end up using the hostname of one interface and the IP address of another interface. In addition, setting NETWORK_INTERFACE only affects the IP address we use and setting NETWORK_HOSTNAME only affects the hostname we use.

In init_local_hostname(), it appears on casual inspection that we'll set the IP address based on the hostname, when we examine the records returned by ipv6_getaddrinfo(). But the IP address is always initialized earlier in the function, because we always have a value for NETWORK_INTERFACE (with '*' as a default).

We should do a better job of having the hostname and IP address we use correspond to the same network interface.
